intro: Myrstiphyllum marginatum, commonly known as the New Zealand myrtle, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and dark green, glossy leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Myrstiphyllum marginatum is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used traditionally by Māori for various purposes.
